metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1868 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The label decompression functionality in PowerDNS Recursor 3.5.x, 3.6.xbefore 3.6.3, and 3.7.x before 3.7.2 and Authoritative (Auth) Server 3.2.x,3.3.x before 3.3.2, and 3.4.x before 3.4.4 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (CPU consumption or crash) via a request with a namethat refers to itself.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-geo - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-ldap - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-lmdb - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-lua - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-mydns - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-mysql - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-pipe - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-remote - 3.4.5-1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 3.4.5-1
pdns-server - 3.4.5-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

pdns-recursor - 3.7.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.5-1').
pdns-recursor package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.3-1').
